reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned home after spending two weeks in the Aimia Hotel.I must confess that I am puzzled by the effusive reviews of this hotel. It is clean certainly but that is something we take for granted in a 4 star hotel . The staff at the desk were helpful but again that is to be expected in a Spanish hotel.
reviews.title: Lacking a vital ingredient
worth every penny!
reviews.text: What we did not expect was the funereal atmosphere in the dining room especially at dinner which made the experience more like a visit to a clinic than the pleasant experience one might have hoped for.On last Saturday night , for example, we and 6 other guests whispered over our meal while the two waitresses tiptoed around the sepulchral surroundings. Some very faint gloomy music accompanied our meal.Not a chance of live music!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a group of corporate folk who had arrived that day but they were whisked off to a barbecue in Nautilus and did not have to endure the gloomy meal in the hotel.Lucky people but no such luck for us!
reviews.title: wonderful hotel wonderful resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our bedroom , number 209, was a standard bedroom and it was the smallest bedroom I have stayed in for many years.We had a "balcony" that measured 36 inches by 48 inches - I measured it! The bathroom was fine with a good size shower but the bedroom itself was just about able to accommodate a standard double bed and one armchair with a small desk. I did see into some other rooms and they were much bigger. As we were there for 14 nights I was sick of the claustrophobic room we were in.Luckily the weather was fine so we spent as little time as we had to in room 209.
reviews.title: A very pleasant hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was free Internet and a daily newspaper - the Daily Telegraph - and the pool area was lovely but we shall be looking elsewhere for accommodation in Puerto Soller when we visit again.
reviews.title: Excellent hote. A real find.
Great Experience
reviews.text: Myself and my husband have just returned from a week long stay in this hotel. We had a fabulous seaview superior room. The hotel exceeded our expecations. The location is fantastic (minutes from the beach), the staff were warm and professional and the food & service was perfect. There is some noise pollution (karaoke) from a nearby hotel, but not enough to detract from our stay. Great hotel and we have already rebooked for next year.

reviews.title: A fresh modern small hotel - worth trying

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent two nights here in April on the second leg of our short break to Majorca. Beautiful hotel set just back off the quiet main road (could see the sea from our balcony). Staff very friendly and helpful, breakfast offered a wide variety of choices and was served in the very pleasant restaurent. The spa was a nice extra touch and we had it all to ourselves more than once! Didn't get chance to try the outdoor pool and terrace due to the weather but it looked to be up to the very high standards of the rest of the hotel. Overall this is an excellent place to treat yourself to a nice relaxing stay in Port de Soller. Will definitely be back here for a mini break and look forward to enjoying the place in sunnier times!
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel, great pool, great food
